messages.message: Not sure where to post this but I noticed that all IB.com (http://IB.com) users (not just admins) can see the full list of users we have on there, including customer ones and their company email addresses. I tested this out signing up with my personal email and it still shows all of this information. What can we do to make sure this isn’t showing? (cc @wadams)
i don’t think there’s a way to prevent this? @Heymian would know better, but it seems she’s OOO

I ask cause we set up customers for training but it looks like they have access to other customers’ email addresses if they search through the admin page. It doesn’t seem like it was brought up by any customers so far but could be a big red flag if they play around and find other corp email addresses on there
completely understand the concern, i just don’t think there’s an immediate solution unless we add permissioning for this in the backend
all good! thanks for confirming. just wanted to bring it up in case we have someone external report it

Heymian can give a more correct answer but iirc we require users to be able to see all other users for features like sharing repos, granting access permissions, etc. I think for trainings and such, sandboxes are a good option too, where you can keep a very narrow and tailored environment.

Makes sense within an organization. Maybe some feedback would be to have the search capability be case sensitive as opposed to suggestive search? If you type in JPMC it shows everyone's name and emails. From a security standpoint these corporate emails (albeit only used for sandbox training and their documents wouldn't have any proprietary information) is still considered personally identifiable information so unless it's explicit that it's being exposed to other people outside their organization poses a security risk for us.

I think the issue is that the system is designed as a single-tenant system but we use IB.com (http://IB.com) as an example as multi-tenant.

@Kristine I agree with you that this could be a security concern as it exposes user details from one customer on that system to the other.
